contrast.definition: The contrast of the grating stimulus.

drifting_velocity.definition: In case of a constantly drifting grating, the temporal frequency

duration_stim.definition: The duration of the stimulus in seconds.

duration_mlg.definition: The duration of the mean luminance grey

function.definition: The function of the described stimulus. E.g. if the white noise constituted the carrier.

grating_type.definition: The type of  grating, i.e. 'sinewave' or 'sqaurewave'.

intensity.definition: The mean intensity of the grating stimulus.

modality.definition: The stimulus modality like acoustic, haptic, visual etc.

orientation.definition: The orientation of the grating in degrees.

output_channel.definition: The physical output device (e.g. an analog output channel, a monitor screen, the same loudspeaker, etc.). This information can be used to explicitely express that several stimuli (that share the same OutputChannel) are jointly	presented.

position.definition: The position of the stimulus on e.g the screen. Specified as a 2-tuple (x;y). By default this position refers to the top-left corner of the object or its bounding box.

position_reference.definition: By default stimulus positions are specified by the coordinates of the top-left corner (or of the bounding box). Use this property for other definitions.

spatial_extent.definition: The spatial extend of the presented stimulus (width;height) e.g. (1024;768).

spatial_frequency.definition: the spatial frequency of the grating.

spatial_wavelength.definition: The spatial wavelength of the  grating.

temporal_offset.definition: The temporal offset (with respect to the begin of the recorded trial) with which this stimulus was	presented.

type.definition: The type of grating used. Commonly either Sinewave or Squarewave gratings are used.
